result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dangelo M Price

records.addlTxt:
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. 
Defendant Dangelo M Price not in court, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court for Dangelo M Price.  Attorney Francesco Mineo in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a plea and sentencing.  However, Defense requests final pre-trial and jury trial dates.  Court scheduled the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Dangelo M Price not in court, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask appeared by video for Dangelo M Price.  Attorney Francesco Mineo in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense requests a plea and sentencing date. Case adjourned, Branch 2.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court, defendant Dangelo M Price not in court, in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held off the record via Zoom. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Status conference scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Turnover to Justice Point for level 5 supervision with all previously ordered conditions

Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court, defendant Dangelo M Price not in court, in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Bail modified to $2,500 cash. Defense requests a status conference date. Case adjourned, Branch 2 via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court, defendant Dangelo M Price not in court, in custody, HOC.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense awaiting offer.  Status conference scheduled for June 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Dangelo M Price in court with attorney Joseph Thomas Domask.  Defendant Dangelo M Price in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision Level 5.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  Scram bracelet ordered to monitor defendant maintains absolute sobriety.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.  No driving without a valid license.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Dangelo M Price in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Dangelo M Price in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Dangelo M Price appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 4 and 5.  Court reserves defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
